description: This galaxy is for the application of prototype HITRUST associated items that do not appear within either the HITRUST CSF nor the HITURST Threat Catalogue.  However, these items help to draw clear connections between HITRUST items and other frameworks like MITRE ATT&CK.
name: HITRUST-PROTOTYPE-CATEGORIES

values.description: Code execution on target system or application.  For example, remote code execution; or some other form of exploitation that allows attackers to execute malicious code.

Attackers leverage vulnerabilities in memory causing buffer overflow or underflow conditions that can lead to multiple possible outcomes.  For example, an attack can cause a buffer overflow event that discloses system information.

Attackers levererage vulnerabilities in software or systems in order to circumvent, disable, or bypass security features.  For example, executing arbitrary code that stops anti-virus software from starting.
Attackers can leverage vulnerabilities in a system to cause the system to disclose or leak information; or, data.
Organizational or organization personnel improperly disposing or destroying data stored on a physical medium.
Attackers may hide code or messages within file, message, image, or video.
